required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Kinesiotape for Edema After Bilateral Total Knee Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Kinesiotaping on Edema Management, Pain and Function on Patients With Bilateral Total Knee Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if kinesiotaping for edema management will decrease post-operative edema in patients with bilateral total knee arthroplasty. The leg receiving kinesiotaping during inpatient rehabilitation may have decreased edema and pain and improved movement and function when compared to the leg not receiving kinesiotape.

detailed_description.textblock: After being informed about the study and potential risk, all patients undergoing inpatient rehabilitation after bilateral total knee arthroplasty will have Kinesio(R)Tape applied to one randomly selected leg while the other leg serves as a control. Measurement of bilateral leg circumference, knee range of motion, numerical rating scale for pain, and selected questions from the Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score will occur at regular intervals throughout the rehabilitation stay. Patients will receive standard rehabilitation.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Repeated measures with two within-subjects factors: time and taped/untaped leg

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline and during 1-2-day time intervals of circumferences of both knees and lower extremities
primary_outcome.time_frame: During inpatient rehabilitation stay for each subject: at baseline (day 0), day 1, day 2, and every other day until day 8
primary_outcome.description: Bilateral circumferences, in centimeters, at the following points: 10 cm above the superior pole of the patella; middle of the knee joint; calf circumference at the broadest part of the calf and at 3 inches below the fibular head landmark; figure of eight method for foot and ankle circumference - a measurement from the lateral malleolus to the navicular tuberosity, under the plantar aspect of the foot towards the tuberosity of the fifth metatarsal, around to the medial malleolus, and posterior to the leg to return to the lateral malleolus.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline and day-to-day changes of bilateral knee pain on numerical pain rating scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During inpatient rehabilitation stay for each subject: at baseline (day 0), day 1, day 2, and every other day until day 8
secondary_outcome.description: Patient self-report: Pain rating for each leg on a integer scale of 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain imaginable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline and during 1-2-day time intervals for bilateral knee range of motion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During inpatient rehabilitation stay for each subject: at baseline (day 0), day 1, day 2, and every other day until day 8
secondary_outcome.description: Physical therapist's measurement of active and active assistive knee range of motion (degrees) for flexion and extension using a standard goniometer

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to Day 4 to Discharge Day for selected parts of the Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS) self-report
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At start of study, 4 days after start of study, and day 8
secondary_outcome.description: Patient self-report using the KOOS sections relating to pain, stiffness, activities of daily living

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline and during 1-2-day time intervals for Timed Up-and-Go Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During inpatient rehabilitation stay for each subject: at baseline (day 0), day 1, day 2, and every other day until day 8
secondary_outcome.description: Time (sec) to rise from a seated position, walk 10 m, turn, walk back to seat, and sit down. Patient will use appropriate assistive device and have appropriate guarding by a physical therapist.

arm_group.description: Kinesio(R)Tape for edema management applied to a randomly selected lower extremity plus standard inpatient rehabilitation after bilateral total knee arthroplasty

arm_group.arm_group_label: Control leg with standard rehabilitation alone
arm_group.description: Control leg receiving standard inpatient rehabilitation alone.

intervention.description: Kinesio(R)Tape is an elastic, cotton tape with an adhesive backing. When applied for edema management, strips of Kinesio(R)Tape are applied to the lower leg in a criss-cross fashion by a physical therapist who is a Certified Kinesiotape Practitioner.
